intro: Centaurea raphanina subsp. mixta, commonly known as the mixed radish centaurea, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by bristly, reddish-brown seeds. The subspecies mixta is distinguished by its slightly different morphology compared to other subspecies of Centaurea raphanina.
